title: Team Foundation Server Team Project
description: Creates a TFS team project. If a project with the same name already exists, does nothing.

tpcUrl.description: The URL of the Team Project Collection in which to create the team project, e.g. "https://myTfs/DefaultCollection"

name.description: The name for the team project

processTemplate.description: The process template for the team project

versionControlType.description: Whether the first repo in the team project should be TFVC or git.

tfsUsername.description: The username (with mandatory domain: <domain>\<username>, for local accounts use . or machine name as domain) of an account that can log on to this machine and that has permissions in TFS to create a team project. In DevTest Labs this is typically the admin user you specify for machine creation (e.g. '.\vmuser').

tfsPassword.description: The password for the TFS Username.

runCommand.commandToExecute: [concat('powershell.exe -ExecutionPolicy bypass "& ./artifact-main.ps1 -tpcUrl ''', parameters('tpcUrl'), '''', ' -name ''', parameters('name') , '''' , ' -processTemplate ''', parameters('processTemplate') , '''' , ' -versionControlType ''', parameters('versionControlType') , '''', ' -tfsUsername ''', parameters('tfsUsername'), '''', ' -tfsPassword ''', parameters('tfsPassword'), '''' , '"')]
